description: Add Only Flag.  Indicates that the service is an add only, not an update.

Cash_PoolObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Cash_PoolObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Cash_PoolObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Cash_Pool_Data.description: This is the Cash Pool unique identifier.

validation.validation: The Web Service is set to 'Add Only,' but the Cash Pool already exists.

Cash_Pool_Data.description: The name for this Cash Pool

validation.validation: There is an existing Cash Pool by this name. Please provide a unique name.

Cash_Pool_Data.description: The description for this Cash Pool
This is to mark the Cash Pool as inactive.

validation.validation: You cannot create a cash pool as Inactive.

Financial_AccountObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Financial_AccountObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Financial_AccountObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Cash_Pool_Data.description: Reference to the Bank Account to be used as the master account for this Cash Pool.

Financial_AccountObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Financial_AccountObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Financial_AccountObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Sub_Bank_Accounts_Data.description: Reference to a Bank Account to be used as a sub account for this Cash Pool.

validation.validation: A sub account cannot be the same as the master account.
Sub account must be unique in a cash pool.
